individual measures._description: Boilers supply hot water or steam for heating applications and can be fueled by natural gas or LPG/distillate. Coal and wood fired boilers may be in service, but are not captured in this measure.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Washer v 5.1 Tier 1

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Assume a capcity of 3.5 ft^3 (p.2, table 1); conversion from original standard - MEF> 1.8; 3.5/1.8 = 1.94.

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential clothes washers that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: MEF is the quotient of the cubic foot capacity of the clothes container divided by the total clothes washer energy comsumption per cycle

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Central AC v 4.1 Tier 2

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Split system (p.2, table 2); conversion from original standard - EER / SEER > 14.5 / 12; COP = EER * 0.293

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential central air conditioners that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: EER is the ratio of the cooling effect measureed in BTU/hour over electrical energy input in Watts; SEER is seasonal EER= the total cooling in Btu during the normal cooling season over the total electric input in Wh in the same period.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Gas Furnace v 2.0 Tier 2

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential natural gas furnaces that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: AFUE = annual fuel utilization efficiency; 'residential furnace' is a heating unit whose function is the combustion of fossil fuel for space heating with forced hot air.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Oil Furnace v 2.0

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential oil furnaces that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: AFUE = annual fuel utilization efficiency; 'residential furnace' is a heating unit whose function is the combustion of fossil fuel for space heating with forced hot air.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Room AC v 2.1

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Capacity 8,000 to 13,999 BTU/hr (p.5, table 1); conversion from original standard EER > 10.8; COP = EER * 0.293

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential room air conditioners that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: EER is the ratio of the cooling effect measureed in BTU/hour over electrical energy input in Watts; SEER is seasonal EER= the total cooling in Btu during the normal cooling season over the total electric input in Wh in the same period.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Air Source HP v 4.1 Tier 2

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Split system (p.2, table 2); conversion from original standard - SEER - 14.5, EER - 12, HSPF - 8.2; COP = EER * .293, COP = HSPF * .293

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential air source heat pumps that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: EER is the ratio of the cooling effect measureed in BTU/hour over electrical energy input in Watts; SEER is seasonal EER = the total cooling in Btu during the normal cooling season over the total electric input in Wh in the same period; HSPF is a measure of a heat pump's energy efficiency over one heating season.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR HP Water Heater v 1.1

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential heat pump water heaters that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: Energy factor is the ratio of energy output of the water heater to the total amount of energy delivered.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Geothermal HP v 3.0 Tier 1

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Closed loop water-to-water (p.6, table 1); conversion from original standard - SEER - 14.5, EER - 12, HSPF - 8.2; COP = EER * .293, COP = HSPF * .293

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential ground source heat pumps that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: EER is a ratio of total cooling capacity to electrical energy input; COP is a ratio of total heating capacity to electrical energy input.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Gas Inst. Water Heater v 1.1

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential gas instantaneous water heater that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: EF is the ratio of useful energy output to the total amount of energy delivered.

individual measures.name: Oil Water Heater, ASHRAE 90.1 c. 2004

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: 50 gallon residential oil water heater that meet the ASHRAE 90.1 performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: EF = 0.59 - (.0019 * Gal); storage and instantaneous are the same standard.

individual measures.name: Resistance Water Heater, ASHRAE 90.1 c. 2007

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential electric resistance water heaters that meet the ASHRAE 90.1 performance standard in 2010.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Windows v 5.0

energy_efficiency_source.notes: Based on U values from ENERGY STAR document (R value = 1 / U value)

installed_cost_source.notes: Double-pane, insulated frame, air fill, SHGC 0.31, U value 0.29.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential double pane windows that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: U-factor is the heat transfer per time per area  and per degree of temperature difference (in Btu/h ft2 F); SHGC is the ratio of the solar heat gain entering the space through the fenestration product to the incident solar radiation.

individual measures.name: Incandescent Bulbs, Fed. Std. c. 1995

installed_cost_source.notes: Average cost of 0.001/lm for incandescent at 15 lm/W for 60 W bulb

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average lifetime of 1375 hours, translated to years.

individual measures._description: Typical wattage residential incandescent reflector bulbs that meet the federal minimum performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: No federal standard applies for general service incandescent until after 2012; assumes 60 W bulb.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR LED Bulbs v 1.2

market_entry_year_source.notes: Year in which ENERGY STAR standard went into effect

energy_efficiency_source.notes: LED lamp power < 10 W, non-standard or replacement lamps

installed_cost_source.notes: Average cost of 0.048/lm for LED at 50 lm/W for 9 W bulb

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average lifetime of 42500 hours, translated to years.

individual measures._description: Typical wattage residential LED bulbs that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: ENERGY STAR standard applies to general service and reflector bulb types; assumed standard bulb is for 60 W replacement, and under 10 W.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR CFL Bulbs v 4.3

energy_efficiency_source.notes: CFL lamp power 10-15 W, bare, covered, globe, and outdoor reflector CFLs

installed_cost_source.notes: Average cost of 0.0023/lm for CFL at 55 lm/W for 13 W bulb

product_lifetime_source.notes: Average lifetime of 9000 hours, translated to years.

individual measures._description: Typical wattage residential CFL bulbs that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: ENERGY STAR standard applies to general service and reflector bulb types; assumed standard bulb is for 60 W replacement, and between 10-15 W.

individual measures.name: Floors, IECC Std. c. 2009

installed_cost_source.notes: Insulating slab, R-15.

product_lifetime_source.notes: Same as lifetime of the home.

individual measures._description: Residential floor slab insuluation that meets IECC 2009.
individual measures._notes: R value is a measure of thermal resistance.

individual measures.name: Walls, IECC Std. c. 2009

installed_cost_source.notes: R-15 XPS.

product_lifetime_source.notes: Same as lifetime of the home.

individual measures._description: Residential wood frame wall insuluation that meets IECC 2009.
individual measures._notes: R value is a measure of thermal resistance.

individual measures.name: ENERGY STAR Gas Str. Water Heater v 1.1

installed_cost_source.notes: Median of total installed cost range.

individual measures._description: Standard size residential gas storage water heater that meet the ENERGY STAR performance standard in 2010.
individual measures._notes: EF is the ratio of useful energy output to the total amount of energy delivered.
